name: Eastbourne Reymar

reviews.text: the best bits about the reymar hotel are the price and the inclusion of the cooked breakfast .
reviews.title: average seaside bed and breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: unfortunately we found some litter from a previous occupant in the room and crumbs on the floor so we didn't look too closely elseware in the room . the en suite was the smallest we've ever seen with the tiniest " hand basin " .
reviews.title: very pleasant stay

reviews.text: We booked this hotel at short notice for 1 night to stay over and watch the firework display following the airshow. We looked at reviews and decided this one had excellent reviews so booked. The reviews were all correct: extremely warm & genuine welcome by Paul, comfortable and well equipped room, extremely clean throughout, fantastic breakfast, well mannered and very obliging staff , excellent location. As this accommodation is available for on line booking, guests were from the continent as well as UK, staff were friendly and helpful to all to ensure everyone was made welcome. we will definitely be back next year!
reviews.title: Long weekend

reviews.text: Arrived Friday 6th Met by Paul the owner the rooms were great, staff very friendly and helpful, food very good no complaints at all, telly in the room or in lounge which was great to use before going out for evening meal
reviews.title: Great stay with the family

reviews.text: My family stayed at this hotel for two nights for a late summer break combined with a trip to Drusillas Park. Paul and the staff were very friendly and helpful right from the start - nothing was too much trouble. We parked our car in the car park (first come, first serve basis). We had a lovely family room which was clean, nicely decorated and meet our needs. A travel cot (with bedding) was also provided in the kids room for our baby at no extra cost. We all had a lovely breakfast and our eldest son's allergies were catered for which was great. Paul even went the extra mile by posting back my son's new toy dinosaur which he left in the hotel lounge :-) Would recommend this hotel for a good value, short stay for any family.
reviews.title: Thank you

reviews.text: Last minute booking, unsure of the area, but I just couldn't ask for more. Perfect location, seconds from the beach, minutes from the town centre. The hotel is very very clean and well maintained. For 2 adults with 2 children we were offered a tripple room and given extra crib free of charge. The english breakfast wasn't up to my taste, but there was plenty more of choices available (toasts/cereal etc) so i wasn't really bothered. Last but definitely not least, big thanks to Paul, who made us feel very welcome and has been a great host. We were allowed to check in a little early and leave the bags untill evening hours on the day of the departure.
reviews.title: Sometimes you just get lucky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, it was a first time but definitely not last. Great value for money.
reviews.title: Exactly what we needed!

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I decided we needed to get away together. I had no idea where to go so at her suggestion we decided on Eastbourne. As it was going to be the Easter weekend I knew that it was not going to be easy finding a place but after trying several hotels and B&Bs based on tripadvisor reviews I found that the Reymar had a double room available and very good reviews.
reviews.title: spot on

reviews.text: The pressure was on as this was our first trip away together so I wanted it to be special and I wanted us to be happy and comfortable. I was a bit worried about the fact that it was a B&B as I'd never been in one though I think that if they get it right then you get a magical time because you get a more personal touch.
reviews.title: It is not a hotel!!

reviews.text: Anyway, I needn't have worried because as soon as we arrived we were greeted very warmly by a lady who handed us our keys, showed us our room and told us where we could park.
reviews.title: very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: had a great stay at the reymar staff very friendly beds a bit springy, great choice at breakfast. lovely location could see the beach from our room. had a nice relaxing break, Eastbourne is a lovely quiet place to visit
reviews.title: nice break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just had a night at this hotel at the weekend, whilst meeting up with family & friends at the local angling club. The hotel location was in an ideal location, it was clean, well maintained, staff were very friendly & helpful & you couldn't ask for a better breakfast. It literally had everything, from fresh fruit, cheeses, meat, croissants, to a full English, big selection of cereal, teas, coffee, juices etc.....
reviews.title: SEASIDE DELIGHT
Bad choice of this "hotel" ( B&B)
reviews.text: very impressed, i sincerely couldn't fault it & would recommend it to anyone.
there was also free wifi & car parking spaces on first come first serve basis.
reviews.title: Fine for a cheap night away

reviews.text: Stayed here last week for work and enjoyed my stay very much. I was the only guest over the weekend and spent one night away at a mate's house in London. On my return there was a note from the owner checking to make sure I was alright. Thoughtfulness all around. Only issues were a bathroom window which wouldn't close and the TV signal wasn't very good (though it was cloudy most of the stay.
reviews.title: Great location, nice people

reviews.text: You can walk to restaurants, pubs and convenience stores. And of course the sea is a half block away.
reviews.title: Faultless!

reviews.text: Huge thanks to Amanda and Paul, who run this lovely hotel so perfectly. I was not expecting the level of service, care, cleanliness and comfort I received at this great find in Eastbourne. It has a great location, no issues with parking, and the rooms are very reasonably priced for the quality of stay.The breakfasts are absolutely yummy and set you up for the day. The whole place is immaculately clean, with compfortable beds, plenty of pillows, towels etc. It sounds like they've had a disgruntled ex-member of staff writing some negative reviews on here, but look at all the positives from real contributing Tripadvisor members. Heartily recommended!
reviews.title: Great Find....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here a couple of times for 4 nights and then 2 nights on the following week and experienced a pleasant stay on both occasions. The Manager and staff are all so helpful and nothing is too much trouble for them. My room was on the top floor and had everything I needed - the drinks tray in the room was very well stocked and the bed was very comfortable, I slept like a log!
reviews.title: Great stay on the South Coast

reviews.text: I only made it down to breakfast on two occasions but the cooked breakfast was great and there was also a good choice of continental as well.
reviews.title: Prefect stay

description: We offer a warm, friendly family atmosphere to rest & relax in. Whether you are on business or pleasure we aim to provide you with a memorable visit. All rooms are en-suite, with Tea/coffee and complimentary biscuits, WIFI, Freeview TV available. Private car park, ground floor & family rooms available. 30m from the sea front and close to many bars, restaurants and town centre. A perfect place to explore the many surrounding attractions.
